Article_Name: Delhi Records Maximum Temperature Of 21.8 Degrees Celsius
News Info: Delhiites experienced a pleasant Wednesday with the maximum temperature in the national capital settling at 21.8 degrees Celsius, a notch below the season's average, according to the India Meteorological Department (IMD).

Article_Name: Question In Tamil, Reply In Hindi Leads To Heated Exchanges In Lok Sabha
News Info: A question asked in Tamil triggered heated exchanges in Lok Sabha on Wednesday between the Opposition and Treasury benches that spilled over to the issue of ministers giving replies in Hindi.

Article_Name: President To Inaugurate New Hall At Mumbai Raj Bhavan On February 11
News Info: President Ram Nath Kovind will inaugurate the new Darbar Hall at Raj Bhavan in Mumbai on Friday, an official statement said.

Article_Name: UP Has Seen "Do Ladkon Wala Khel": PM Modi Takes Dig At Rival Alliance
News Info: In the 2019 Lok Sabha polls, the BSP, Samajwadi and RLD had formed an alliance against the BJP. The Congress with its leader Rahul Gandhi and Samajwadi Party had fought the 2017 assembly polls in the state in an alliance.

Article_Name: In Letter To Agency, Mumbai Ex-Cop Wants To Turn Approver Against Ex-Minister
News Info: Dismissed Mumbai police officer Sachin Waze has written a letter to Enforcement Directorate, saying he wants to turn an approver in a money laundering case registered by the central agency against former Maharashtra minister Anil Deshmukh and others.

Article_Name: New York State Lifts Indoor Mask Mandate As Covid Cases Drop
News Info: New York on Wednesday became the latest Democrat-run state to announce it was lifting indoor mask mandates for businesses.

Article_Name: "Didn't Attack Anyone's Family": PM Modi On His Nehru Invective
News Info: Tackling criticism of inflation on his watch, PM Modi had gone back to Jawaharlal Nehru's address to the nation from the Red Fort as India's first Prime Minister where he had said that the war on Korea was causing inflation in India.

Article_Name: No Need For PM Modi To Certify Tamil's Patriotism, Says MK Stalin
News Info: Tamil Nadu Chief Minister MK Stalin on Wednesday hit out at Prime Minister Narendra Modi over his recent remarks and said there was no need for the PM to certify the patriotism of Tamils.

Article_Name: People Of UP Will Teach BJP A Lesson Because Of Its "Faulty Policies": Mayawati
News Info: Asking people not to be swayed by tall promises of political parties, BSP supremo Mayawati on Wednesday claimed people of Uttar Pradesh will teach the ruling BJP a lesson in the assembly polls because of its "faulty policies".

Article_Name: "No Place For Any Other Dress...": Sena's Aaditya Thackeray On Hijab Row
News Info: Amid the ongoing Hijab row in Karnataka, Maharashtra Minister Aaditya Thackeray on Wednesday said that there should not be a place for any other dress other than the school uniform at the schools.

Article_Name: Queen of Denmark Tests Positive For Covid
News Info: Denmark's Queen Margrethe II has tested positive for Covid-19, experiencing only mild symptoms, the Royal House said Wednesday.

Article_Name: "Were Called 'Gujarat Ke Gadhe'": PM Predicts Doom Again For UP Rivals
News Info: Prime Minister Narendra Modi today exuded confidence about victory in Uttar Pradesh - a state Amit Shah said will decide the fate of the country-- and mocked the opposition alliance as "game of two boys".

Article_Name: Dr Reddy's Laboratories Gets FDA Approval, Launches Drug In US Market
News Info: Dr Reddy's Laboratories on Wednesday said it has launched a vasopressin injection, which is used to control frequent urination, increased thirst, and loss of water caused by diabetes, in the American market.

Article_Name: Your Cellphone Bills Will Get Larger, Airtel Says It May Go First
News Info: Telecom operator Bharti Airtel may take lead in hiking mobile call and services rates this year as it looks to increase average revenue per user to Rs 200, a top official of the company said.

Article_Name: Deaths Rise To 80 In Madagascar Cyclone, 94,000 In Need Of Assistance
News Info: The death countfrom Tropical Cyclone Batsirai has risen to 80, Madagascar's authorities said Wednesday, releasing data from the regions hardest-hit by the storm that left bodies buried under their collapsed homes.
